qas.question: What activities from these mammals will likely affect   habitat areas?
What underground items have lead to soil degradation?
What kind of pressure can be intense in the Sahara?
What is least likely to affect a habitat?

plausible_answers.text: irrigated water pumped from underground aquifers

context: <a0_0><b3_0>human activities<b3_0/><a0_0/> are more likely to affect the habitat in areas of permanent water (oases) or where water comes close to the surface. Here, the <b4_0>local pressure<b4_0/> on <a2_0>natural resources<a2_0/> can be intense. The remaining populations of <b5_0>large mammals<b5_0/> have been greatly reduced by <b6_0>hunting for food and recreation<b6_0/>. In recent years development projects have started in the deserts of Algeria and Tunisia using <a1_0><b7_0>irrigated water pumped<a1_0/> from underground aquifers<b7_0/>. These schemes often lead to soil degradation and salinization.
